DIV2.HEAD: II. XV SIGNA ANTE IUDICIUM. (A fragment.)

LG.L: Þe grace of ihsu fulle of miȝte
þroȝ prier of ure swete leuedi
mote a-mang vs nuþe aliȝte
and euer vs ȝem and saui.
Man and woman þou aȝtist tak gome
þis world-is ending how hit ssal be
þe wondres þat sal com be for þe dome
þat ȝung and old hit sal ise
þe xv tokingis ichul ȝou telle
as us techiþ ysaie
þe holi gost him taȝt ful welle
and he hit prechid for profecie
hit is iwrit in holi boke
as clerkis hit mow se and rede
þat no þing no man mai loke
þat is so grisful forto drede
þer nis aliue so sinful man
if he þer of wold tak kepe
and he wold þench apan
þat nold wel sore in herte wepe
Godmen takiþ nou gome
of tokninges þat commiþ bi for
þe children wiþ in þe moder wome
wel sore sul dicce and drede þer for
wiþ in þe moder wom. hi sul grede
vp ihsu criste euer to crie
louerde crist þou red vs rede
and of vs þou hab mercie
we wold louerd þat we ner
in world icome forto bene
and vnbeȝet of ure fader wer
þat al þing nou sal suffri tene
Þe first tokning sal be þusse
al for soþ we sul hit see [The first tokyn]
and þat oþer sal be wors
for soþ ȝe nou wel liue me
þe sterris þat þou sest so briȝte
in heuen aboue þat sit so fast
for man-is sin sal ȝiue no liȝt
ac sal adun to erþe be cast
as fair and briȝte as þou seest ham
hi worþ be-com as blak as cole
and be of hiwe durke and wan
for man-is sin þat hi sul þole In the MS. the stanzas that follow are written in two lines instead of four.
Þer nis aliue so stidfast man
þat þer of ne sal agrise
him to hide he ne can
no whoder to fle in none wise
bot as bestis þat wer wode
a-ȝe oþir to erne. her and þare
for þi hi ne sul can no gode
see no lond hi ne sul spare
þan þe dede up sal arise
up har biriles forto sitte
of þilk dai hi sul agrise
and lok as bestis þat cun no witte
Þe þrid dai þan amorow

as we fint in holi boke
þe sone þat nov schiniþ so briȝt
þilk dai þou salt i-se

and þat for dred so hit sal be
abute þe time of middai

we mov sigge wailawai
moch is þe pine þat we sul þole
Þe ferþ dai þat silf son
worþ as rede as hit wer fire

bi for ihsu þe heiȝ sire
Þe fifte tokning þat sal be-fal
þat allirkin maner beste

Þe sixte dai ne lef ich noȝt

hou þe fentis sul men har mone
wel aȝtist þe faire to lede

Þe .xi. dai fure windis sul rise
and þe reinbow þan sal fal

for wolny nulni hi sul fle
and þat in to þe pine of helle

þe .xii. dai þe fure. elemens sul cri

as þou ert god and king of heuene.
Þe grace of god ful of miȝt . þat is king an euer was: For the a' (= and), an is printed here.
mote amang us aliȝt . an ȝiue vs alle is swet grace.
me to spek an ȝou to lere . þat hit be worsip lord to þe:
me to teche an ȝou to bere . þat helplich to ure sowles be.
þat ic mote wiþ moch worþing . þroȝ is miȝt so hit ful fille:
to ȝov schow is vp-rising . if hit be his swet wille.
al þat god suffrid of pine . hit nas noȝt for is owne gilt:
ok hit was man for sin þine: þat wer for sin in helle ipilt.
þo lucifer steiȝ in pride . þat was angel in heuen so briȝte:
vte of heuen he gan glide . an in to helle sone he liȝte.
an wiþ him mani an mo . þat no tunge ne miȝt tell:
wiþ him fille adune al so: in to þe derk pit of helle.
Seue daies a seue niȝt . as ȝe seeþ þat falliþ snowe:
vte of heuen hi aliȝt . an in to helle wer iþrow.
for þe prude of lucifer . þe teþe angle fille in to helle:
an al þat to him boxum were . euer in pine hi mot dwelle.
har stides for to ful fille . þat wer i-falle for prude an hore:
god makid adam to is wille . to fille har stides þat wer ilor.
Skil resun an eke miȝt . he ȝef adam in his mode:
to be stidfast wiþ al riȝt . an leue þe harme an do gode.
god ȝaf him a gret maistre . of al þat was in watir an londe:
of paradis al þe balye . whan him likid to is honde.
foules . bestis . an þe frute . saf o tre he him forbede:
of paradis þe grete dute: an ȝit he sinied þroȝ iuil red.
to him þe deuil had envie . þat he in his stid schold be broȝte:
a serpent he com þroȝ felonie . an makid eue chonge hir þoȝt
whi com he raþer to eue . þan he com to adam.
ichul ȝou telle sires be leue . for womman is lef euer to man.
womman mai turne man-is wille. whare ȝho wol pilt hir to:
þat is þe resun an skille . þat þe deuyl com hir first to.
Ette he seid of þis appil . if þat þou wolt witti be:
þe worþ as witti of miȝt an wille: as god him silf in trinite
hi nad bot þat appil i-ȝette . þat þe sin nas ido:
glad was þe deuil wol ȝe i-wit . for þe sorow þat he sold to.
of paradis hi wer ute pilt . wiþ trauail har liuelode to winne:
an vte flemid for har gilt . an neuer efte paradis to com inne.
In þe vale of eboir . his liuelod he most swink sore:
wiþ sorow an care an dreri won . he liued .ix.c. ȝer an more.
aftir is lif þat he had here . nedis he most wend to helle:
for þe trepas þat he did here . þere he most bide an dwelle.
God makid mankin more . ok to helle þe deuil ham broȝt:
þat euir ham traiid þroȝ is lore . non fram him scapid noȝt.
god is prophetis to ham send . an seid hov hi sold be sauid:
as bi Moyses þat am wend . a-ȝe þe propheci ȝit i-sinid.
god wist wel bi þilk say . þat bi no man þat was y-cor:
whan bi prophetis no bi lai . þat communelich hine wer for-lor.
holi bok is fort fulfil . god is angle anon forþ send:
as bi angle gabriel . þat to þe maid was iwend.
flees he took of maid mari . god an man-is kund to gadir:
an þat was a gret maistri . þat þe doȝtir ber þe fader.
maid bere heuen king . þat is al ure creatoure:
maid ber þe swet þing . þer for sso ne les noȝt hir flure.
God him ȝed an erþ here . xxxti winter an somdel mo:
as holi writ vs gan lere . he suffrid boþe pine an wo.
man aȝens god so gilt . to heuen non sowle ne miȝte:
fort god-is sone in rode was pilt . an wan vs heuen liȝt.
Iudas ne cuþe is lord noȝt hold . his owen disciple ȝit he was:
for xxx peniis he him sold . ynom an ibund he was.
he was ibobid an i-smitte . an hi spette in is face:
he bede him rede if he cuþe witte . woch of ham al hit was.
he was ibund to a tre . an ibet wiþ scurges kene:
þat al þe blode vt gan fle: ouer al is bodi hit was sene.
Siþ hi nom him as a þef . an lad him bi-for pilate:
for he nas noȝt to ham lef . hi had to him grete hate.
pilat bed ham do har best . a-ȝe þe law be he nold:
for no gilt bi him he nist . war for deþ suffri he ssold.
hi nailed him in hond an fete . as ȝe mow al i-se:
for þe appil þat adam ete: deþ he þolid opon þe tre.
þe wikkid men nol leue noȝt . þat he wer fullich ded so:
fort þer wiþ a sper hi ad him soȝt . an clef is swet hert atwo.
þer was in þe lond a kniȝt . þat het ȝosep of arimathie:
þat louid ihsu wel ariȝt . an þoȝt is wel to honuri.
he wend to pilat swiþe snel . an be-soȝt him mercy:
if hit wer is wil . þe bodi grant biri.
þo pilat had igrant is luue . glade y-noȝ ho was:
he nem þat swet bodi adun . an biriid hir in a fair plas.
his moder stode him be side . an st. jon ek al so:
bitter teris vte gan glide . hir þoȝt hir hert wol a two.
hit nas no wonder þoȝ ȝo wep . for hir swet child alowe:
wiþ nailes he was i-smit dep . wiþ sper hi delet him in two.
al hir ioi was ago . þo ȝo him sei dei in rode:
for to wep ȝe nad no mo . bot iiii bitter teris of blode.
who spekiþ of deil a-ȝe þat del . neuer such nas þer none:
as whan þat hi him be-held . as ȝho makid an seint Jon.
siþ hi seid at one mouþe . þat he wolde destru temple an chirche:
an þat he was wel couþe . þat al falsnis schold wirche.
an vp pilat hi cried apan . eu[ri]chon at one vois:
þat he schold hold barabam . an do ihsu on þe crois.
In þis manere he was ipinsed . as his swet wil hit was:
an deþ for mankyn suffred . þe þrid dai vp he ros.
after þat he liȝt in to helle . þer al þe sowles wer i-wisse:
al his frendis he broȝt vt alle . in to ioi an heuen blis.
Whan in helle was seint ion . patriarkes an oþer mo:
hit isene þer scapid non . profetis þat god louid al so.
al in helle were i-fast . fort ihsu crist þroȝ is miȝte:
of þe pit vte he ham cast . an broȝt ham to heuen lyȝt.
þroȝ is deþ he ouer cam . as he is manhed siwed:
as profetis prechid in his name . so þat he deþ suffrid.
þo he rose fram deþ to liue . as telliþ daui þe king:
is godhed he gan to kiþe . holy boke telliþ is up-rising.
ihsu was sikir inoȝ . þat seid erlich. ic wol riȝt me:
an asnward wiþ vt woȝ . after þat deþ ouercom be.
þe .iii. dai he ros to liue . is lore riuedlich he send:
his deciplis he makid bliþe . þer after in þe world ham send.
of his lore forto preche . hou hi lord ssold siu þe:
an þe sinful folk to tech . hou meri hit is to wiþ þe be.
an after he steiȝ to heuen aboue . þer ioi is þat euer lest:
an þer he sal al vs loue . in his swet blisful fest. amen.

DIV2.HEAD: IV. THE TEN COMMANDMENTS: against swearing, Sunday trading &c.

LG.L: Nou ihsu for þi derworþ blode: þat þou schaddist for mankyn:
ȝif vs grace to wirch workis gode . to heuen þat we mot enter inn.
Man and womman ic red be ware . ȝure gret oþis þat ȝe be leue:
and bot ȝe nul god nel ȝou spare . boþe lif and catel he wol ȝou reue.
hit nis no wonder for soþ i wisse: þat gret wreche ne falliþ þer fore:
for we ne leuiþ of al is limmes . þat we ne habbiþ ham for-swore.
man is wors þan eni hunde . oþer he is to wild and wode:
þat we ssold edwite is worþi wound . þat he þolid for vre gode.
be a ware whose euer wol . al quelme and sorow þat euir is:
at þen end so find we sulle . þat for man-is sin it is
ic rede þat euch be ware i-wis . in as moch as þe is man:
whan ȝe sweriþ gret oþis . in rode þou piltist him apan.
God commandid to ysay . þat he ssold wend and prech:
þat was in þe hil of syna . hou he ssold þe folke tech.
and to ssow ham god-is defens: boþe to ȝung and to olde.
of þe .x. commandemens . whos wold be sauid ham ssold hold.
Þe first comondement is þis . o god we ssul honuri:
þe heiȝ king of heuen blis . his name wiþ wirssip to worþi.
loue þou him as he doþ þe . wiþ al þi miȝt an þi þoȝt:
we auȝt ful wel for hit was he . þat vs wrecchis so dere boȝt.
more harm is we doþ noȝt so . we louid þe ful dritte of grunde:
alas wrecchis whi do we so . hit mai noȝt hold vre lif a stunde:
ve beþ hi þe deuil be tauȝt . þat liuiþ op goddis mo þan one:
and makiþ goddis þroȝ wichcraft . þai ssul al to þe deuil gone.
Þe secunde so is þis . sundai wel þat ȝe holde:
to serue god þilk dai wis . boþe ȝung and eke olde.
and now þe sundai opunlich . men holt al har cheping:
wonder þat gode ne sent wreech . al an erþe vp mankyn.
þe þrid is. fader moder to honuri . for euch man aȝt ful wel:
moch ten suffrid hi: her hi miȝt bring þe wrecche to wel.
hit falliþ bi children þat beþ quede: as fariþ bi been in hiue:
whan fader ȝuief ham londe and leede: þe ȝung wol þe old ut driue:
þe verþ. loue þi neiȝbore . as þine owe bodi: non oþer þou him wil:
þe fift wit þe fram licheri: þe sixt is no gode of man þou ne stel.
þe .vii. manslaȝt þou ne be: ne coueit noȝt neuer adel
þoȝ þou be stuter þan is he: no is wif no is catel.
fals witnes þou ne ber . for to destrei pouer no riche:
sore and bitter þe soule sal der . for hit bemineþ heuen-riche.
besech we him mild of mode . þat sok þe milk of maid-is brest:
þat boȝt vs wiþ is der blod . ȝiue vs euer in heuen rest. Amen.

DIV2.HEAD: V. FRAGMENT ON THE SEVEN SINS.

LG.L: Þe king of heuen mid us be
þe fend of helle fram us te
to dai and euir more:
to dai me ȝiue gode beginninge
þe king of houen to worþing
and speken of is lore.
and þat ȝe hit mote vnderstonde
þe fend to mochil schame and schonde
þis predicacioune.
and þat ȝe hit hold mote
bodi and soule to mochil bote
and to saluacioune.
Alle we beþ meiis and mowe
and of one foule erþe i-sowe
who so hit wold vnderstonde
þis world-is wel nis bot wowe
þis wrecche lif nis bot a þrow
al dai hit is gond.
Man . ne be þou neuer so riche
be-hold whom þou art iliche
whan þou ert al nakid
be-þench þat þou salt i-worþe
and for-roti to axin and erþe
whar of þou ert makid
Clansi þe of þi misdede
and lerne welle þi lif to lede
þe while þou art aliue.
to nene frend þou nab triste
bot to one ihesu criste
to child no to wiue.
Mi leue frendis ic ȝou bi-seche
ȝung . old . poure and reche
herkenþ to god-is speche:
in þe name of god. and S. marie
ȝoure sinful lif to amendie
to-dai ic wol ȝow teche.
And þat he me let so wel to spek
to dai þe deuil-is staf to brek
an wiþ him so to fiȝte.
þerto . par charite ic ȝou crie
a pater noster . and aue marie
in þe name of god al-miȝte.
Þat pees þat is in god-is huse
to dai be a-mangis vse
þroȝ is holi grace:
þat me giue lif. and gode ending
and to ȝou ȝiue gode lusting
in þis silue place.
God him silf seiiþ in his gospel
mi leue frendis ic wol ȝou tel
nimiþ to me gome:
o worde ic ȝou lie nelle
of heuen blis no pine of helle
no of riche dome.
and of þe herrid sinnes seuene
whar for men lesiþ heuene
ic wol ȝou nemeni alle
and har namis ic wol ȝou teche
and hou hi wol men bi-peche
and make ham to falle.
First at prude i wol be-gin . for hit is heuid of al sinne.
ic hit wol ȝou do to wit . in holi boke hit is i writ. [Pride.]
Lucifer þat was so briȝte . þat fairist was of al wiȝte.
wiþ oute god in heuen nas . non so fair als he was.
nas neuer non so fule ifund . as he in helle liþ abund.
nad he no more gilte . whar for he was of heuen ipilte
a litil prude him was in-com . þer-for god him hauiþ be-nome.
heuen blisse þat euer sal last . and in to helle he is cast.
þer he sal woni euer more . and is prude abigge wel sore.
alas. man whi artu prute . whannin commiþ þi fair schrute.
mid whate þou art ischrid aboute. noȝte of þe man boute doute.
þine owen schond þou werist an . þat heliþ þi fleis and þi bone.
ic wol þat þou iwit wel . hit nis bote a hori felle.
þat is þine owen riȝt wede . beþenche þe man and hab drede.
man and womman vnderstond þis . be-tak euch beste his.
þat ert so fair mid bi gon . linin. wollin. glouis. and schone.
þat þou art in hit so prute . ne sal þe leue neuer a cloute.
þer-for man ic þe bede. worldlich prude in hert and dede.
and lede þi lif bi godis rede . to loui god and hab drede.
þat þou be gode-is sone . and him to queme at þe dome.
Coueitise is þat oþer . herkne nov leue broþer.
þer is mani man bi peiȝte . so þe fend him hauiþ iteiȝte. Couei∣tise.]
þe man þat is coueituse . ne commiþ he neuer to god-is huse.
suche þer beþ al to fele . þat louiþ more þis world-is welle.
þan god þat haþ ham of erþe iwroȝte. and so swithe dere ham boȝte.
he nel is catel spen in wast . ac euer he hit witiþ fast.
he nold þat aliue nere . none so riche as he were.
and euer so he hauiþ more . þe faster he gaderiþ to store.
and euer he wol is lif so lede . in mochel sorow and in drede.
nel he neuer hab rest . is mochil mukke to witi fast.
þat ne mai in him slepe cum . lest is mukke be him be nome.
leuer him wer ȝiue of is blode . þan ani man of is gode.
nel he of oþir þing hede . but is fule bodi fede.
mid is siluir and is gold . noȝt is soule þat he schold.
a-pan is muk he sit a-brode . he þat þus doþ mid is gode.
he ne þenchith noȝt in is end . þat he sal of þis world wend.
and vnderstonde noȝt he nelle. what he is no whoder he schel.
his catel he weniþ witi wel . oc in his soule þenche he nelle.
with is siluir and is gold . he weniþ euer is lif hold.
whan he weniþ liuie wel . mid deþ adun fal he schel.
þe deuil benimiþ him is breþ . moch sorow þan he him deþ.
for is gode þe fend him deriiþ . and is soul to helle he feriiþ.
þe deuil is his executur . of is gold and is tresure.
þat he so moch trist to . loke nou hou he is ago.
þerfor man in alle wise . ic þe for-bede coueitise.
to world-is wel nab þou no triste. hit went awei so doþ þe miste.
her it is and her hit nis . al so fareþ þe world-is blis.
ne be he neuer so riche . whan he liþ a cold liche.
if he hauiþ an old clute. he mai be swiþe prute.
whar mid i-helid he sal be . þat noman nakid him ise.
of what he gadred an is was. nis þis rewþ. alas. alas.
Þe þrid sin so is onde . þat mochil nuþe is in lond.
and euir hi quemiþ þe fend of helle. in woch maner ic wol ȝou tel.
leue breþerin herkniþ now. and ic wol ȝou tell how.
world-is wel falliþ vnliche. and noȝt euch man ilich.
sum þer beþ þat cun noȝt libbe. sum þat hauiþ frendis sibbe.
and sum þer beþ þat swinkiþ sore. winne catel to hab more.
ham silf fair to susteni. and euer more hi beþ nedi.
and sum þer beþ leue broþer. þat more haþ þan anoþer.
and more loue of gode man . anoþer wol after þan.
areri cuntake.

DIV2.HEAD: VI. CHRIST ON THE CROSS. (A fragment.)

EPIGRAPH.Q: Respice in faciem christi tui &c. Augustinus.
pendens nudatum pectus. rubet sanguineum latus. regia pallent ora. decora languent lumina. crura pendent marmorea. rigat terre beatos pedes sanguinis unda. De istis auctoritatibus anglicum.

LG.L: Be-hold to þi lord man. whare he hangiþ on rode.
and weep if þou miȝt. teris al of blode.
and loke to is heued. wiþ þornis al be-wonde.
and to is felle so bi-spette. and to þe sper-is wnde.
bi-hold to is brest nakid. and is blodi side.
stiniith is armis. þat sprad beþ so wide.
his fair lere falowiþ. and dimmiþ is siȝte.
þer-to is hendi bodi. on rode so is y-tiȝte.
his lendin so hangiþ. as cold as marbre stone.
for luste of lechuri. nas þer neuer none.
be-hold to is nailes. in hond and ek in fote.
and how þe stremis erniþ. of is swet blode.
be-ginne at is heued. and loke to is to.
þou ne findest in is bodi. bot anguis and wo.
turne him uppe. turne him doune. þi swete lemman.
ouer al þou findist him. blodi oþer wan.
Dilexit nos et lauit nos a peccatis nostris in sanguine suo &c.
Leue for þe mi brest nakid. schiniþ glisminge.
mi side dep istunge. mi hondes sore bleding.

DIV2.P: Quid misericordius ualet intelligi ipsi peccatori eternis tormentis dampnato et vnde se redimat non habenti quam ut dicat deus ipse peccatori . Dicit vero deus pater . Accipe unigenitum meum et da pro te . et ille filius tolle me et redime te. Anglicum expone.

LG.L: Man þou hast þe for-lor. and ful neiþ to helle ibor.
wend a-ȝe and com to me. and ic wol underfang þe.
for first ic makid þe of. noȝt. and siþ dere þe i-boȝt.
whan ic mi lif ȝef for þe. and i-hang was on tre. &c.

DIV2.P: O homo; vide quid pro te patior sicut est dolor sicut dolor quo crucior. ad te clamo qui pro te morior. uides penas quibus afficior. uide clauos quibus confodior. si est tantus dolor exterior. interius est planctus grauior.

LG.L: Man bi-hold what ic for þe. þolid up þe rode tre
ne mai no kinnes wo be mare. þan min was þo ic heng þare.
hire me man to þe gredind. for loue of þe biter deiend.
loke mi pinis biter and strang. wan ic was nailed þroȝ fot and hond.
for þe ic had hard stundes. dintes grete and sore wondes.
for þe biter drink ic dronk. and þou cunnest me no þonk.
wiþ-vte ic was ipinid sore. wiþ-in ic was mochil more.
for þou nelt þonk me. þe loue þat ich schowid þe &c.
Loue hauiþ me broȝt in liþir þoȝt.
þoȝt ic ab to blinne:
blinne to þench hit is for noȝt;
Noȝt is loue of sinne.
Sinne me hauiþ in care ibroȝt.
broȝt in mochil vn-winne:
winne to weld ic had i-þoȝt;
þoȝt is þat ic am inne.
In me is care. how i ssal fare.
fare ic wol and funde.
fare ic wiþ outen are
ar i be broȝt to grunde.

þe mai & nele þider come . sore it him scal ofþinche The later MS. ends here.
Þer is blisse abuten treȝe . & lif abuten deaþe
þe eure scullen wunien þer . bliþe muwen ben eþe
Þer is ȝeoȝeðe bute ulde . & hele abuten vn-helðe
nis þer sorewe ne sor . ne neure nan vn-sealþe
Þer me scal drihte sulf i-seon . swa he is mid iwisse
he one mai & scal al beo . engle & manne blisse
And ðeh ne beod heore eȝe naht . alle iliche brihte
ði nabbed hi nouht iliche . alle of godes lihte
On þisse liue hi neren nout . alle of one mihte
ne þer ne scullen hi habben god . alle bi one ȝihte
Þo scullen more of him seon . þe luuede him her more
& more icnawen & iwiten . his mihte & his ore
On him hi scullen finden al þat man mai to lesten
hali boc hi sculle iseon . al þat hi her nusten
Crist scal one beon inou . alle his durlinges
he one is muchele mare & betere . þanne alle oþere þinges
Inoh he haued þe hine haueð . þe alle þing wealdeð
of him to sene nis no sed . wel hem is þe hine bi-healdeð
God is so mere & swa muchel . in his godcunnesse
þat al þat is. & al þat wes . is wurse þenne he & lesse
Ne mai it neure no man oþer segge mid iwisse
hu muchele murhðe habbet þo . þe beod inne godes blisse
To þere blisse us bringe god . þe rixlet abuten ende
þenne he vre soule vn-bint . of licames bende
Crist ȝyue us leden her swilc lif . & habben her swilc ende
þat we moten þuder come . wanne we henne wende. Amen.
Seint Dunstan was of Engelond: income of gode more
Miracle oure louerd dude for him: er he were ibore
For þo he was in his moder wombe: a candelmasse day
Þer folc was at churche ynouȝ: as to þe tyme lay
As hi stode mid here liȝt: as me doþ ȝut nou
Here liȝt aqueynte oueral: here non nuste hou
Her liȝt hit brende suyþe wel: and her liȝt hit was oute
Þat folc stod in gret wonder: and also in grete doute
And hi speke ech to oþer: in whiche manere hit were
Hou hit queynte so sodeynliche: þe liȝt þat hi here
¶ As hi stode and speke þerof: in gret wounder echon
Seint Dunstanes moder taper: afure worþ anon
Þat heo huld on hire hond: heo nuste whannes hit com
Þat folc stod and bihuld: and gret wonder þerof nom
Ne non nuste wannes hit com: bote þurf our louerdes grace
Þerof hi tende here liȝt: alle in þe place
¶ What was þat oure louerd crist: þe liȝt fram heuene sende
And þat folc þat stod aboute: here taperes þerof tende
Bote of þat holi child: þat was in hire wombe þere
Al Engelonde scholde þe bet beo iliȝt: þat hit ibore were
Þis child was ibore neoȝe hondred ȝer: and fyue and tuenti ariȝt
After þat oure suete louerd: in his moder was aliȝt
Þe furste ȝer of þe crouning: of þe king Adelston
His moder het kenedride: his fader Herston
¶ Þo þis child was an vrþe ibore: his freond nome þerto hede
Hi lete hit do to Glastnebury: to norischi and to fete
To teche him eke his bileue: pater noster and crede
Þe child wax and wel iþeȝ: for hit moste nede
¶ Lute ȝeme he nom to þe wordle: to alle godnisse he drouȝ
Ech man þat hurde of him speke: hadde of him ioye ynouȝ
Þo he was of manes wit: to his vncle he gan go
Þe archebischop of Canterbury: seint Aldelm þat was þo
Þat makede wiþ him ioye ynouȝ: and euere þe lengere þe more
Þo he seȝ of his godnisse: and of his wyse lore
For deynte þat he hadde of him: he let him sone bringe
Bifore þe prince of Engelond: Adelstan þe kynge
Þe kyng him makede ioye ynouȝ: and grantede al his bone
Of what þinge so he wolde bidde: if hit were to done
Þo bad he him an abbei: þat he was forþ on ibroȝt
Þi [? pi] þe toun of Glastnebure: þat he ne wornde him noȝt
¶ Þe king grantede his bone: and after him also
Edmund his broþer þat was king: in his poer ido
To Glastnebury wende sone: þis gode man seint Dunstan
Þo beye þe kynges him ȝeue leue: Edmund and Adelstan
¶ Of þe hous of Glastnebure: a gret ordeynour he was
And makede moche of gode reule: þat neuer er among hem nas
Ac þat hous þat furst bigonne: four hondred ȝer bifore
And eke þreo and vyfti: er seint Dunstan were ibore
For þer was ordre of monekes: er seint patrik com
And er seint Austyn to Engelonde: brouȝte cristendom.
And seint patrick deide tuo hondred: and tuo and vyfti ȝer
After þat oure suete leuedi: oure louerd here ber
Ac none monekes þer nere furst: bote as in hudinge echon
And as men þat drowe to wyldernisse: for drede of godes fon.
¶ Seint Dunstan and seint Adelwold: as oure louerd hit bisay
I-ordeyned to preostes were: al in one day
Þer after sone to Glastnebury: seint Dunstan anon wende
He was abbod þer ymaked: his lyf to amende
¶ And for he nolde bi his wille: no tyme idel beo
A priuei smyþþe bi his celle: he gan him biseo
For whan he moste of oreisouns: reste for werinisse
To worke he wolde his honden do: to fleo idelnisse
Seruie he wolde poure men: þe wyle he miȝte deore
Al þe dai for þe loue of god: he ne kipte of hem non hure
And whan he sat at his worc þer: his honden at his dede
And his his hurte mid ihesu crist: his mouþ his bedes bede
¶ So þat al at one tyme: he was at þreo stedes
His honden þer, his hurte at god: his mouþ to bidde his bedes
Þerfore þe deuel hadde of him: gret enuye and onde
O tyme he cam to his smyþþe: alone him to fonde
Riȝt as þe sonne wende adoun: riȝt as he womman were
And spac wiþ him of his worc: wiþ laȝinge chere
And seide þat heo hadde wiþ him: gret worc to done
Treoflinge heo smot her and þer: in anoþer tale sone
¶ Þat holi man hadde gret wonder: þat heo was and þere
He sat longe and biþoȝte him: longe hou hit were
He biþoȝte him ho hit was: he droȝ forþ his tonge
And leide in þe hote fur: and spac faire longe
Forte þe tonge was al afure: and siþþe stille ynouȝ
Þe deuel he hente bi þe nose: and wel faste drouȝ
He tuengde and schok hire bi þe nose: þat þe fur out blaste
Þe deuel wrickede her and þer: and he huld euere faste
He ȝal and hupte and drouȝ aȝe: and makede grislish bere
He nolde for al his biȝete: þat he hadde icome þere
Mid his tonge he snytte hire nose: and tuengde hire sore
For hit was wiþinne þe nyȝte: he nemiȝte iseo nomore
Þe schrewe was glad and bliþe ynouȝ: þo he was out of his honde
He fleȝ and gradde bi þe lifte: þat me hurde in-to al þe londe
Out what haþ þe calewe ido: what haþ þe calewe ido.
In þe contrai me hurde wide: hou þe schrewe gradde so
As god þe schrewe hadde ibeo: atom ysnyt his nose
He ne hiȝede no more þiderward: to hele him of þe pose
¶ Þe holi abbot seint Dunstan: hadde gret poer
Wiþ king Edmund þat was þo: and was al his consailler
After king Edmundes deþ: a good while was a gon
Þat Edwyne his sone was ymaked king: and noȝt after anon
Þis Edwyne hadde vuel red: and þerafter drouȝ
Wiþ seint Dunstan he was wroþ: siker wiþ gret wouȝ
¶ Of his abbey he dude him out: and dude him schame ynouȝ
Þe more schame þat he him dude: þe more þe gode man louȝ
He drof him out of Engelond: and let him grede fleme
Þis gode man wende forþ wel glad: ne nam he neuere ȝeme
To þe abbey of seint Amand: biȝunde see he drouȝ
And soiournede þer longe: and ladde god lyf ynouȝ
¶ After kyng Edwynes lyue: Edgar þat was his broþer
Was king ymaked: for he was nher þan enie oþer
Suyþe god man he bicom: and louede wel holi churche
And ech man þat him þerto radde: after him he gan wirche
Me tolde him of seint Dunstan: þat his broþer drof of londe
Mid vnriȝt for his godnisse: and gan him vnderstonde
¶ After him he sende anon: þat he come aȝe sone
And bileue his consailler: of þat he hadde to done
Seint Dunstan com hom aȝen: and faire was vnderfonge
Ladde his Abbey al in pees: fram whan he was so longe
Wiþ þe king he was suyþe wel: and was al his consailler
Moche me spac of his godnisse: boþe fur and nher
Hit biful þat þe bischop: of wircetre was ded
Þe king and þe archebischop Ode: þerof nome here red
¶ Þo þe holi abbot seint Dunstan: bischop hi makede þere
To makie him heȝere in godes lawe: his wille þeȝ hit nere
Somme eschte þe archebischop: of Canterbury sire Ode
Wherfore hi him bischop makede: and his grace were so gode
For he schal, quaþ þis gode man: after me her beo
Archebischop of Canterbury: þat me schal iseo
¶ What saistou, þis oþer seide: þu spext folliche iwis
Nostou nomore þan þi fot: vppe god al hit is
¶ Leoue freond, quaþ þis gode man: ne þore ȝe ne blamie noȝt
Wel ic wot what mie louerd crist: in mie mouþ haþ ibrouȝt
As ho saiþ of þulke þinge: þat he haþ in me ised
Telle ic mai what schal bifalle: after þat ich am ded
Bischop he was of Londone and Wircetre: and hulþ boþe two
Of Londone and of Wircetre: and bischop was of boþe also
¶ Hit biful þat þe archebischop: of Canterbury was ded
Þe pope and þe kyng Edgar: þerof nome here red
And makede þe gode seint Dunstan: archebischop þere
Gode men þat him iknewe: wel glad þerof were
Cristendom in Engelond: to god stat he drouȝ
And riȝtes of holi churche: he huld vp faste ynouȝ
He fondede þurf al Engelond: þat ech persoun schulde cheose
To witien him fram lecherie: oþer his churche leose
¶ Seint Osewold was þulke tyme: bischop of wyrcestre
And seint Adelwold also: bischop of Roucestre
Þis tuei bischopes and seint Dunstan: were al at one rede
And Edgar þe gode king: to do þis gode dede
¶ Þis þreo bischops wende forþ: þurf al Engelonde
And eche liþer persoun caste out: þat þer nemiȝte non atstonde
Here churchen and here oþer gode: clanliche hi bynome
And bisette hit in pore men: þurf þe popes grant of Rome
Eiȝte and fourti Abbeyes: of Monekes and of nonne
Of þe tresour hi arerde in Engelond: of persones so iwonne
So hit was wel bet biset: þan hit was er in schrewe
For whanne gode maistres beoþ: som god hi wolleþ schewe
¶ Gode were þis þreo bischops: þat o tyme were þo
Þe betere is Engelond for hem: and worþ euere mo
¶ Oure louerd ȝaf an vrþe: seint Dunstan faire grace
Þat o tyme as he was: in a priueie place
His fader and his moder ek: in þe ioye of heuene anheȝ
After þat hi dede were: aperteliche he seȝ
Wel gret loue oure louerd him cudde: whan he schewede þere
So moche of his priueite: þe while he alyue were
As he lay anoþer tyme: in his reste anyȝt
He seȝ þe ioye of heuene: and þe place þerinne wel briȝt
Angles he hurde also singe: a murie song þer inne
Þat me singeþ ȝut in holi churche: whan me doþ þe masse singe
Kirieleyson. christeleyson: was þe murie note and song
Þis holi man þat þis ihurde: ne þoȝte hit him noȝt longe
¶ Wel auȝte he to heuene come: after his ende day
Whan he þe while he was alyue: so moche of heuene isay
Harpe he louede suyþe wel: þeron he couþe ynouȝ
A day he he sat in solaȝ: and a lay þeron drouȝ
¶ Þe harpe he heng bi þe wowe: þo hit was tyme to ete
Þo hit was ȝare þerto ibrouȝt: he sat adoun at his mete
Of heuene he gan þenche sone: of þe ioye þat was þere
Of þe ioyfulle blisse þat þer was: of halewen þat þer were
He sat as he were ynome: so moche þeron he þoȝte
His harpe he heng bi þe wowe: of wham he lute roȝte
¶ Bigan to cuþe his holi þoȝt: ded treo þeȝ hit were
As oure louerdes wille was: as hi hurde alle þat þer were þere
Al bi him silue he gan to harpe: a murie steuene iwis
Þat ne singeþ ȝut in holi churche: þat an englisch is þis
Alle halewene soule glade beoþ: þat in heuene beoþ ido
Þat suyeþ oure louerdes way: and for him schadde also
Here blod for his suete loue: þerfore hi schulle wone
And kynges beo bouten ende: wiþ crist godes sone
Þis anteyn þat murie is: þat folc ihurde alle
Hou þe harpe song al bi him silf: þer he hong bi þe walle
Fair grace oure louerd him schowede þere: whan þe dede treo
So schulde singe of þulke ioye: þat he scholde inne beo
Louerd ihered beo þi grace: and þi miȝte also
Þat þu woldest her alyue for him: such miracle do
¶ Þo þis holi man hadde ylyued: an vrþe menie a daie
And his endedai was neȝ icome: as he him silue isaie
A holi þursday he worþ sik: as hit ful in þe ȝere
He let ofsende his freond: þat specials to him were
His men þat him seruede eke: he let hem clipie also
And forȝaf hem al here trespas: þat hi him hadde misdo
And assoillede hem of here sinne: and in godes bendes lay
And so he lay al þulke tyme: and also þane friday
He let clipie þe saterday: þe freres bifore him alle
And bed alle godneday: and seide hem what scholde bifalle
And let him do alle his riȝtes: and oure louerdes flesch nom
¶ His soule wende out of þe wordle: and sone to heuene com
Neoȝe hondred ȝer and fourscore: in þe eiȝteteoþe ȝere
He deide after þat oure leuedi: oure louerd an vrþe bere
Nou suete louerd seint Dunstan: þat oure archebischop were
Bring ous to þe ioye of heuene: as angles þi soule bere.

TAILNOTE.P:
On p. 61 back, is:
Ou marie þat is so moche: þi milce and þyn ore
so murie hit is to telle of þe: þat ȝut we mote more.
The fifth miracle is that of]

LG.L: A kniȝt þer was in Engelond: by norþe her biside
A ȝung child he hadde bi his wyf: as god wolde hit scholde bitide
Þe moder adai while hit was ȝung: to churche hit broȝte
Þe child bihuld þe rode in churche: and stod in grete þoȝte
Moder, he seide, what is þe man: þat ȝund anhongod is
¶ Sone, quaþ þe leuedi, hit is: oure louerd iwis
For ous he was so anhonge: and to deþe ibroȝt
To bringe ous to þe ioye of heuene: he haþ ous deore iboȝt
Wel auȝte we þanne, quaþ þe child: seruie him wiþ wille
And what is þulke faire womman: þat stent bi him so stille
Hit is his moder, quaþ þe leuedi: þat oure suete leuedi is
Ou ma dame, quaþ þe child: wounder me þinȝþ hit iwis
¶ Stod heo bi him þo me him slouȝ: þe leuedi seide ȝe
Awey ma dame, quaþ þis child: miȝtestou so bi me
Hou miȝte heo iseo quelle hire child: þat hire hurte ne brac atuo
Moche del was on hire hurte: and sorinysche also
Þeȝ þis child were ȝung: of þis deol ofte siþe hit þoȝte
Selþe wher he euere were: out of his hurte he hit brouȝte
Þis child was siþþe ido to scole: hit lurnede wel ynouȝ
So þat he com to Oxenford: þo he to manne drouȝ
Selþe hit com out of his þoȝt: what so he iseȝe
Þe deol þat oure leuedi hadde: þo heo iseȝ here sone deye
¶ Hit biful siþþe in a tyme: as hit doþ bi menie on
Þat he dude a dedlich synne: so ne dude he neuere non
He nolde noȝt, as manie on wolleþ: ligge þeron longe
To a frere he wende to schrifte: his penance to afonge
Repentant he was ynouȝ: of þulke liþere dede
And bisouȝte him for þulke sinne: þat he for him bede
And þat he bede to oure leuedi for þulke sor: þat heo hadde on hire þoȝt
Þo he seȝ hire sone anhonge: and in stronge deþe ibroȝt
Þat heo ȝyue me grace and wille: þe leuedi milce and freo
Sorie ynou in hurte: for mio sinne to beo
Þat he bad eke him silf: boþe niȝt and day
For þe deol of hire sone: þo heo dim ded isay
¶ He hadde þe while he lyuede: þulke bone in mone
Þat oure leuedi þo he was ded: him cudde and eke hire sone
Atte laste at Oxenford: at scole he gan deye
Þe furste day he was iwist: as þe maystres iseye
Tuey clerkes þat were ouer him: þat suyþe wel his freond were
Þat wiste his bodi niȝt and day: and were next þe bere
Ech man amorwe bote hi tueye: wende hom in his ende
Felawe, quaþ on, hit is tyme: þat we þe taperes tende
Abyd, quaþ þoþer, a stounde: þat þis maistres come
Hit nis noȝt riȝt þe tapres tende: bote hi were her some
¶ As þis tuey clerkes were alone: adoun hi lynede stille
So þat hi werþe a slepe: as hit was godes wille
As hi slepe, hem þoȝte boþe: þat hi angles meniee iseȝe
Here felawes soule þat þer lai ded: to heuene lede heȝe
¶ Oure leuede as to teche þe wey: hire silue ȝeode bifore
And openede þe dore of heuene: þat þe soule were in ibore
¶ Þo heo tofore oure louerd com: adoun heo sat a kneo
Sone, heo saide, lo, her mie freond: þat wel haþ iserued me
Vnderfong him into þi ioye: oure louerd aȝe sede
Leoue moder ic auȝte wel: þeȝ þu neuere ne bede
For an vrþe he bad mie milce ofte: for þe deol þat þu iseȝe
And þat sor in þin hurte: þo þu me seȝe deye
Wel fawe ic him wole afonge: as riȝt is þat ich do
And among myn halewen him onoury: and þu schalt also
¶ Þo sende oure leuedi fram heuene: to þe tapres liȝt anon
Þat aboute þe bodi stede: and tende hem echon
Þe clerkes awoke anon: as hi slepe boþe þer
And fonde þe tapres alle itend: as hem þoȝte in slepe er
¶ Þo come þe maistres as riȝt was: þe seruise for to do
And þo hit was to ende ibrouȝt: and þe bodi ibured also
Þe clerkes to here priue maistre: tolde al þat hi seȝe
Þat oure leuedi to oure louerd seide: in þe ioye of heuene heȝe
And hou hi onourede him for þe munde: þat he hadde her in mode
Of þe deol þat oure leuedi hadde: of hire sone in þe rode
Hi ȝeode forþ to þe frere: þat his schriftfader was
Somme of þe maistres priueiliche: and tolde him of þat cas
¶ Þe frere seide þat hit was soþ: þat he hadde er in mode
Þe deol þat oure leuedi hadde: þo hire sone deide on þe Rode
Þe miracle was þo iholde soþ: of þis holi childe
Wiþ eche þing al day we seoþ: oure leuedi suete and mylde

DIV2.HEAD: XI. THE JEWS AND THE CROSS.

LG.L: Gywes hatieþ oure leuedi moche: and hire suete sone also
Þat is isene in manie dede: þat þe schrewen habbeþ ido
Oure leuedi day in haruest: þat so holi is and suete
An archebischop song his masse: in þe cite of Tolete
Riȝt atte sacring of þe masse: atte þulke holi dede
A voiȝ he hurde of heuene: þat þuse wordes sede
Allas þe gywes trecherie: Allas þe liþere vode
Þat among mie sones children: þat he bouȝte mid his blode
Þe schrewen schulle so vylliche: eftsone do him on þe Rode
And so schendfulliche auyli: wiþ so liþere mode
Þe archebischop þo he hadde: his masse ibroȝt to ende
He nom wiþ him folc ynouȝ: and to þe gywene gan wende
And let ofseche oueral: atte laste hi fonde
Þe forme of oure louerd in a Rode: ibeten and ibounde
Inaïlled þurf fet and honde: as oure louerd wiþ vyf wounde
Þat hadde þe gywes ido: god ȝyue hem harde stounde
And alle þat hem louye wel: for moche is þe vylte
And schame þat hi ofte doþ: oure louerd in priueite
¶ ȝut oure leuedi aliȝte: and warnede þe bischop fore
Moche godnisse heo haþ ido: siþþe heo was ibore
Nou, leuedi, for þe mylce: þat euere haþ mid þe ibeo
And for þe grete sorwe þat þu haddest: þo þi sone deide on þe treo
ȝeue ous grace þat we mote: such milce her iwynne
Þat we mote to þe ioye: come þat þu ert inne.
Seint swiÞin þe confessour: was her of Engelonde
Biside wynchestre he was ibore: as ic vnderstonde
Bi þe kinges day Egberd: þis gode man was ibore
Þat þo was king of Engelond: and somwhat ek bifore
Þe eiȝteteoþe king he was þat com: after kenewold þe kynge
Þat seint beryn dude to cristendom: in Engelonde furst bringe
¶ Ac seint Austin hadde bifore: to cristendom ibroȝt
Aþelbriȝt þe gode king: ac al þe londe noȝt
Ac siþþe hit was þat seint berin: her bi weste wende
And turnde þe king kenewold: as oure louerd him grace sende
So þat seint Egberd þat was kyng: þo seint swithin was ibore
Þe eiȝteteoþe he was: after kenewold: þat so longe was bifore
¶ Seint swythin þe ȝunge man: swiþe ȝung bigan
Forto seruie ihesu crist: and bicom cristene man
Elmeston þe bischop ek: of wynchestre þat was þo
Seint swithin he makede preost: as he dude oþere mo
So þat fram on ordre to oþer: seint swiþin preost bicom
¶ Clene lyf he ladde and god: and to gret penance him nom
His godnisse was wide icud: aboute in eche side
Þo þat hit com þe king to ere: hit sprong aboute wide
Þe king him onourede swiþe wel: and louede him ynouȝ
And makede him his chiefe consailler: and mest to his consail drouȝ
Aþulf his sone and eke his heir: he tok hem to loke
To norissie and to wardie wel: þat hi to gode toke
Þat he teiȝte him such portoure: þat to a such child bicome
Wel him wiste þis holi man: and god warde to him nom
¶ Þo kyng Egberd was ded: þis child Aþulf his sone
After him was kyng ymaked: as lawe was and wone
Þis ȝunge king was god ynouȝ: as seint swithin him gan rede
After his consail al he drouȝ: and dude bi him his dede
Engelond was þo wel iwist: for þe king was god ynouȝ
And swithin his consailler: after wham he drouȝ
Elmeston þe bischop siþþe: of wynchestre was ded
Þe king and oþer heȝe men: þerof neme here red
¶ Þis holi man seint swiþin: bischop hi makede þere
Alle men þat him iknewe: ioyous þerof were
Bischop he was god ynouȝ: and alle gode he wroȝte
Þe king also to alle gode: holi churche brouȝte
So þat þurf þe heste of þe king: and þurf his wissinge also
Ech man wolde þurf þe lond: his teoþing wel do
Brokene churchen oueral: seint swithin let vp rere
And nue churchen in menie stede: þer neuerer none nere
Whan he halewede enie churche: bost ne kipte he non
Bi nyȝte afote myldeliche: he wolde þider gon
Aȝen him ne kipte he no ringinge: bobance ne prute
Þe bost of hors ne of squiers: for he tolde þerof lute
He þoȝte on þat þe godspel. saiþ: þat me takþ of lute hede
Þat ho so doþ his dede mid bobance: him ne tyt non oþer mede
For he afongeþ his mede her: mid þe dede anon
Þat worþ habbeþ nou forȝute: þis heȝe meny on
¶ Seint swithin his bischopriche: to alle gode drouȝ
Þe toun also of wynchestre: he amendede ynouȝ
Þor he let þe stronge brugge: wiþoute þe est ȝate arere
And fond þerto lym and ston: to worcmen þat þer were
¶ Adai as þis worcmen: aboute here worke stode
And contrai men to chepinge: come mid moche gode
Mid a baggeful of eiren: a womman þer com
A masoun sone þis womman: to his folie nom
And biclipte hire in ribaudie: as foles doþ ȝut ofte
And brak hire eiren neȝ echone: he ne handlede hire noȝt softe
¶ Þo þe womman hire harm iseȝ: ruliche heo gan bigynne
For heo hem hadde igadered longe: sum siluer forto wynne
Heo makede deol ynouȝ: and cride also anheȝ
¶ Seint swythin com þo þerforþ: and þe deol iseȝ
Of þis womman he hadde reuþe: he nom vp his hond anon
And blessede þe eiren to-broke: and hi bicome hole anon
And sound as hi euere were: hi bicome atte laste
Glad was þo þis seli womman: and þonkede gost faste
Miȝte eirmongers nou fare so: þe baldelikere hi miȝte
Huppe ouer diches wher hi wolde: boþe wraxli and fiȝte
¶ Þe king Aþulf deide siþþe: þe kynges sone Egberd
And his sone was kyng after him: kyng Adelberd
Hit nas noȝt longe afterward: þat he was ymaked kyng
Þat þis holi man seint swithin: drouȝ to endyng
For he deide þe þridde ȝer: þat he was kyng ymad
And þo he schulde hunne wende: his men faste he bad
Þat hi ne scholde him burie noȝt: in churche wiþ prute
Ac sum war wiþoute in a stede: þat me tolde of lute
In a stede þat me tolde of lest: and lest ȝeme me tok
In alle manere þis holi man: bobance and prute forsok
He deide eiȝte hondred ȝer: and in þe sixteoþe ȝere
After þat oure louerd aliȝt: in his moder wombe here
¶ In a stede wiþoute þe churche: þis holi bodi hi leide
Þat me tolde of lute ynouȝ: as he him silue seide
Þer he lai an hondred ȝer: and neoȝe ȝer also
And almest fourtene nyȝt: er he were þanne ido
Bi þe kinges day Edgar: þat god was ynouȝ
Þat seint Edwardes fader was: þat his stipmoder a-slouȝ
Þis holi man seint swiþþin: schowede bitokeninge
Þat me scholde of þulke place: in heȝere stede him bringe
Þis Egdgar was þe noeȝþe kyng: þat after Adelbert com
Þat kyng was þulke tyme: þat seint swiþþin deþ nom
Þe bischop þat was at wynchestre: þo king Edgar was kyng
Þat was seint Athelwold: god and holi þurf alle þing
¶ Seint swithin þe holi man: a god tyme him gan biseo
Whan god kyng was and god bischop: ischryned for to beo
Aniȝt he cam to an holi man: in his bedes as he lay
In siknisse and sorwe ynouȝ: as he hadde ido meny a day
Arys, he seide, to morwe anon: and ne lef þu noȝt bihynde
To wynchestre þe olde Mynstre: and þere þu schalt fynde
Þe gode bischop Athelwold: þat þe teoþe is after me
And saye þat ich him grett wel: and sende him word bi þe
Þat oure louerd hit haþ biseȝe: þat mie bodi schal beo ido
In churche in an heȝ stede: and nomore ligge so
And if þu doutest in enie poynt: þat þis beo duelsinge
And noȝt soþ þat ich telle nou: ic wole sende to þe kynge
For al so sone as þu wolt arise: forto do myn heste
Þat vuel þat þu hast so longe ihad: ne schal no leng ileste
Ac þu worst þerof hol and sound: wordle wiþouten ende
If þe bischop ne leoueþ hit noȝt: oþer signe ic wole him sende
For whan ȝe comeþ to þulke stede: þer ic ligge ȝute
Anoneward þer liþ a ston: wiþ oþer prute wel lute
Ringes of yre þer beoþ on: ynailled þerto faste
Ac þer nis non so strong of hem: þat aȝen ȝou schulleþ ilaste
Þat ȝe ne schulleþ riȝt liȝtliche: drawe vp þe ston
Wiþoute wem faste aȝen: fast sette hem on
¶ Þis gode man of þis tokning: iolyf was ynouȝ
Wel bityme he aros: and toward þane wey drouȝ
And anon so he dude him on þe wei: hol and sound he was
Of þe vuel þat he bar so longe: neuereft igreued he nas
To þe bischop he wende Aþelwold: and tolde him of þis cas
Þe bischop þo he hurde þis: wel was him þas
Þe ring þat was on þe ston: faste as he seide er
Liȝtliche hi of nome wiþoute wem: and as faste sette hit þer
Wele þe ioye þat he makede þo: þe bischop Aþelwold
Þis miracle was sone icud: and wide aboute itold
Seint Aþelwold wende sone: to Edgar þe gode king
And tolde him as wel was riȝt: þis holi teþing
¶ Þis gode king was glad ynouȝ: hi nomen hem to rede
Hou hi miȝte mid mest honer: do þis holi dede
Hi assignede a dai þerto: as here consayl bisay
Bifore haruest in þe mounþ of Juli: þe eiȝteteoþe day
¶ Hi sumnede aȝe þis holi day: heȝe men ynowe þerto
Bischopes and Abbotes: þe holi dede to do
Þo hi come to wynchestre: þer þis bodie lay
In fasting and oreisouns: hi were niȝt and day
Þat oure louerd hem ȝeue grace: þis holi dede wel ende
Þo þe dai him was icome: to þe mynstre hi gonne wende
Ireuested faire ynouȝ: wiþ gret deuocioun
Wiþ tapres itend and þe croiȝ: wiþ gret processioun
To þe tumbe hi wende sone: as þe bodi lay
As hit ful in þe mounþ of Juli: þe vyfteoþe day
¶ Þis holi bischop Aþelwold: as riȝt was to do
Let delue to þis holi bodie: and þo hi come þerto
Þer com smyte out a suete breþ: among þis gode men echon
Þat so gret suetnisse as hem þoȝte: ne smylde hi neuere non
Louerd moche is þi miȝte: soþ hit is ised
Þat a bodi scholde so suete smylle: þat so longe hadde ibeo ded
ȝe witeþ bi oþer dede men: þat hit was moche aȝe riȝte
A blynd womman anon mid þe dede: in þe place hadde hire siȝte
And menie oþere þer botnede ek: of vuel and of wo
And wiþ-inne þe tuey dayes: two hondred and mo
¶ Þis holi bodi was vp ynome: wiþ gret honour iwis
And into seinte peteres churche ibore: þer þe heȝe mynstre is
And ido in a fair schrin and noble: as hit liþ ȝute
Þe miracles þat of him comeþ: for soþe ne beoþ noȝt lute
Ischryned he was neoȝene and tuenti ȝere: in þon and tuenteoþe ȝere
After þat oure louerd and vrþe aliȝte: in his moder here
Nou seint swithin þat was bischop: her in Engelonde
Bringe ous to þe ioye of heuene: þurf oure louerdes sonde.
Seint kenelm þe ȝunge kyng: þurf oure louerdes sonde
Kyng he was in Engelond: of þe March of Walis
Þe kyng kenulf his fader was: þat kyng was þer also
Þat rerde abbai of wynchecumbe: & let þer monekes do
After his deþ he was þer ibured: & ȝut he lyþ þere
In þe abbay þat ȝut stent: þat he him silue let rere
Gret Cite was þo wynchecumbe: & mest of ynouȝ
In al þulke half of Engelond: as fur as his lond drouȝ.
¶ Vyf kynges þer were bi þulke tyme: in Engelonde ido
For Engelond was god & long: & brod ynou þerto
Aboute eiȝte hondred mile: Engelond long is
Fram þe souþ in to þe norþ: & two hondred brod iwis
Fram þe est in to þe west: also þere-inne beoþ
Manye wateres goode ynowe: as ȝe alday iseoþ
Ac þreo wateres principales: of alle oþere beo iwis
Humber & temese: seuerne þe þridde is
To þe norþ see humber goþ: þat is on of þe beste
& temese into þe est see: & seuerne bi weste
Þis vyf kynges of engelonde: þat were bi olde dawe
Hadde here part bi hem silue: as riȝt was & lawe
Þe kyng þat was of þe Marche: hadde þo þe beste
Moche del he hadde of Engelond: þat on half al bi weste
¶ Wircestreschire & warewykschire: & also Gloucestre
Þat is neȝ al o bischopriche: þe bischopes of Wircestre
He hadde also þerto shestreschire: & Derbischire also
& staffordschire þat beoþ alle: in o bischopriche ido
In þe bischopriche of Chestre: ȝut he hadde þerto
Schropschyre sum & haluendel: warewykschire also
Þis kyng hadde also herefordschire: þat o bischopriche is
& Schropschire haluendel: þat falþ to þulke bischopriche iwis
& sum of warewykschire: & of Gloucestreschire also
ȝut hadde þe king of þe marche: more lond þerto
Norhampte schire & bokingham schire: & þe schire of Oxenford
Leicestreschire & Lincolneschire: & þe schire of hereford
& þat is o bischopriche: & þat of Lincolne is
Þat while was at Dorkcestre biside Oxenford iwis
ȝut hadde þe kyng of þe marche: Notingham schire þerto
In þe bischopriche of Ouerwyke: ac þo nas hit noȝt so
Al þe lond was while icliped: þe march of Wales
& of al was seint kenelm: & his fader kyng iwis
Nou of alle þoþerene kynedom: aȝen his non nas
At wynchecumbe of al his lond: þe chief Cite was
¶ Þe vif kinges þat were þo: þat on was of kent iwis
& þat oþer as ic seide er: of þe march of walis
Of westsex & of humberlond: & of estlond also
Þuse vyf kynges were þo: in Engelond ido
¶ Þe king of westsex hadde þo: al wilteschire iwis
& Dorsete & barrocschire: þat also bischopriche is
Þe bischopriche of salesbury: ac so nas hit þo noȝt
For þe chief of þe bischopriche was: at schireburne ibroȝt
ȝut was þe kynges of westsex: al souþsex also
Þe welde of al þe bischopriche: Cicestre þerto
& souþhampteschire & souþereye: þat o bischopriche is
Þe bischopriche of wynchestre: þat ȝut is þer iwis
& somersete þat to welles: þulke tyme drouȝ
Nou hit is þe bischopriche of baþe: ȝe witeþ wel ynouȝ
¶ ȝut hadde þe kyng of westsex: aldoneschir iwis
& Cornwaille þat in þe bischopriche: of Excestre is
¶ Þe kyng of kent was þo kyng: of al þe lond of kent
Þat were in tuo bischopriches: & ȝut nis noȝt iwent
¶ Þe Archebischop of Canterbury: of Engelond is hext
& þe bischopriche of Roucestre: in þe west side is next
Þe kyng ek of estlond: king was of Norfolc
In þe bischopriche of Norþwych: & also souþfolc
& of þe bischopriche of Ely: þat þe ylle of Ely is
& of al Cantebrugge: þat þerto falþ iwis
¶ Of þis lond was seint Edmund: king bi olde dawe
Þat was in his owe lond: ȝe witeþ wel aslawe
¶ Þe kyng of Norþhumberland: was kyng ic vnderstonde
Of al þe lond biȝunde humber: anon into scotlonde
Of þe Archebischopriche of Euerwyk: & of Durham iwis
Seint Osewald bi olde dawe: kyng was ouer al þis
¶ Þus menie kynges þer were: while in Engelonde
& here londes departed were: þus ic vnderstonde
Þe kyng þat was þo of þe March: as ic telle bigan
Kenulf þe kyng was icleped: suyþe holi & god man
Seint kenelm his sone was: & his eir also
Bur wenylde & quendride: his douȝtren were tuo
In þe four & tuenti ȝer: of his kynedom
Kenulf wende out of þis wordle: & to þe ioye of heuene com
Hit was after þat oure louerd: in his moder aliȝte
Eiȝte hondred ȝer & neoȝentene: bi acountes riȝte
Seint Kenelm his ȝunge sone: in his soueþe ȝere
Kyng was ymaked after him: þeȝ he ȝung were
¶ His o soster bur wenylde: louede him ynouȝ
& in eche manere to holi lyfe: & to alle godnisse drouȝ
Ac quendride þoþer soster: of hire manere nas noȝt
For heo turnede to folie & to liþerhede: al hire þoȝt
Heo seȝ þat hire ȝunge broþer: nas noȝt of soue ȝer
Þat kyng was ymaked of al þat lond: þat hire fader hadde er
To him heo hadde gret enuye: þat he scholde so riche beo
& eir of hire fader lond: & ricchere þane heo
Heo þoȝte if heo miȝte bringe: þat child of lyfdawe
Þat heo were of þe heritage: quene bi riȝte lawe
Al hire þoȝt was nyȝt & day: to biþenche sum outrage
Þat þis child were ibroȝt of dawe: & heo hadde þe heritage
Heo purueide hire felonye: poisoun streng ynouȝ
For to ȝyue þe ȝunge child: & slen him so wiþ wouȝ
Þo þis poisoun was iȝeue: al for noȝt hit was
For þo þe child hit hadde idronke: no þe wors him nas
For oure louerd nold noȝt þat he scholde: so liȝtliche ymartred beo
If þe quene wolde spede: oþer heo moste biseo
For þerof heo caste an ambesas: heo þoȝte anoþer þoȝt
Þo heo seȝ hit was for noȝt: þat þe poisoun was iwroȝt
¶ Þis ȝunge child a maister hadde: þat his wardeyn was
Askebert he was icliped: strong traitour allas
For noman nemai þan oþer: bet trecherie do
Þat þulke þat is him next: & he trist mest to
¶ Þis liþere quene biþoȝte hire: of alle liþer wrenche
For me saiþ þere nis no felonye: þat womman ne can biþenche
Mid þis Askebert heo spac: þat child forto aspille
And bihet him mede god ynouȝ: & of hire al his wille
So þat þis tuo liþere þinges: were at one rede
& bispeke hou hi miȝte best: do þis liþere dede
Þe while hi speke boþe: þis ȝunge child to quelle
A sweueninge þat þe child mette: ich ȝou wole nou telle
¶ Him þoȝte þat þer stod a treo: riȝt tofore his bedde
Þat anon to þe sterren tilde: & wel wide spredde
Þis treo was fair & noble: & schynde briȝte ynouȝ
Ful of blosmes & of frut: & of menie a riche bouȝ
Brenninge wex & lampen ek: wel þikke brende & liȝte
So noble frut nas neuere non: ne þat schynde so briȝte
Him þoȝte he clemde vpon þis treo: to þe hexte bouȝ an heȝ
& bihuld aboute in to al þe wordle: & prute ynouȝ iseȝ
Þe while he stod vpon þe treo: & bihuld aboute so
Him þoȝte þat on of his beste freond: þat he mest triste to
In þe grounde stod byneþe: & smot atuo þis treo
Þat hit fil to grounde anon: þat deol hit was to seo
To a litel foȝel he bicom: non fairere ne miȝte beo
& bi-gan wiþ ioye ynouȝ: riȝt into heuene fleo
He awook & was in þoȝte: her-of nyȝt & day
Þo þis child mette þus: at wynchecumbe he lay
He nuste what hit bitoknede: þe more was his þoȝt
Er he sumþing þerof wiste: he ne miȝte beo bliþe noȝt
His norice þat him hadde ifed: & mid hire mulc forþ ibroȝt
Tendre was of þis child: for heo him hadde deorest iboȝt
To hire þat child triste mest: wolwenne hire name was
Þat child hire tolde priueite: of þis sweuening al þat cas
Þo þe norice hadde ihurd: þat sweuening þat was so god
Heo bigan to sike sore: & in þoȝte stod
Allas heo seide þat ich scholde: þisne day euere abide
Þat mie child mie swete hurte: scholde such þing bitide
Allas mie child mie suete fode: þat ich habbe forþ ibroȝt
Þi soster bispekeþ þi deþ: & quelle þe haþ iþoȝt
Ac þe fowel þat þu bicome to: þat to heuene gan wende
Þat was þi soule þat þider schal: after þi lyues ende
¶ Þis sueuene bicom soþ ynouȝ: þat he fond atte laste
For his soster & Askebert: bispeke his deþ wel faste
¶ Þis Askebert seide adai: þat þis child scholde wende
An hunting forto pleyen him: bi þe wodes ende
& he wiþ him to wardi him: as hit was riȝt bi weye
He wende to þe wode of Clent: as hit were to pleye
As hi wende bi þe wode: as god ȝaf þe grace
A god wille þe child com on: to slepe in a place
Adoun he lay al softe þere: & bigan to slepe anon
Askebert ne þoȝte noȝt: þat he scholde þanne gon
Biside in a durne stede: he bigan to delue faste
Ane put forto sle þis child: & siþþe þeron hit caste
¶ Þis child bigan to awake sone: as hit were bi cas
After his maister he bihuld: & ne seȝ noȝt whar he was
Ac oure louerd him ȝaf þe grace: þeȝ he nuste noȝt of his dede
Þat he spac to his maister: & þuse wordes sede
Þu trauaillest þere aboute noȝt: & þi while þu dost spille
For in an noþer stede ic schal deye: whar so is godes wille
& þurf þis ȝurd þat her is: tokning þu schalt iseo
Whan þi liþere wille hit mai do: þat ich ymartred beo
For wende þis liþere maister: & þis child also
Forte hi come to anoþer stede: þat þis dede were ido
Askebert þis ȝurd nom: & sette hit on þe grounde
Hit bigan to leuy sone: & wexe in a stounde
& a gret asch bicom siþþe: & stent in þulke place
To schewi þe miȝte of seint kenelm: & oure louerdes grace
Þis liþere man nom þis child: in þe wode of Clent
& ladde him as me doþ ane þeof: to afonge his iugement
He ladde him in a priuei stede: al out of þe weye
Bitwene tuei hilles heȝe: in a dupe valeye
¶ Þis child þurf þe holi gost: þeȝ þoþer him nolde telle
Wiste wel his liþere þoȝt: & þat he þoȝte him aquelle
& þo he targede a lute while: þis liþere dede to done
Þat child seide wel myldeliche: þat þu dost, do sone
He bigan a song þat me singeþ: in holi churche a day
Þat was te domine laudamus: er he adoun lay
& þo he cam to an holi vers: þat þerinne was & is
A latyn iwrite as al þat oþer: þat an englische is þis
Þe white cumpaignye of martirs: louerd herieþ þe: Te mar∣tirum candidatus laudat exercitus
Riȝt as he hadde þe vers iseid: as þe boc telleþ me
Þis liþere man smot of his heued: vnder an haȝþorn treo
As hit godes wille was: þat he ymartrid scholde beo
A whit coluere as eni snow: out of him gan fleo teo
& riȝt euene was iseȝe: into heuene fleo
Vneþe he was soue ȝer old: er he ymartrid were
Al to soþ his sueuene was: as me miȝte iseo þere
¶ Þis liþere man þat him a-slouȝ: bigan to delue faste
And makede a put deope ynouȝ: & þerinne þe child caste
And burede hit faste ynouȝ: þat hit ifonde nere
And wende ȝe forþ his wei: & let hit ligge þere
¶ To quendride his liþere soster: anon he gan wende
And tolde hire al þe liþere cas: fram bigynninge to þan ende
Þis quene was þo glad ynouȝ: aboute heo wende anon
Forto seisi al þe lond: & þe maners echon
And makede hir quene of al þe March: as hire broþer was kyng
& schrewe leuedi bicom ynouȝ: & liþer þurf alle þing
& wende aboute into al þe lond: to fonge here manrede
& bicom sturne & huld hire men: in sorewe & wrechede
Nou in þe quedes part mote heo ride: fram toune to toune
And falsliche as heo com anheȝ: also heo ful þerdoune
Heo let hote in to al þat lond: þat no man so wod were
To nemne enes hire broþer name: for loue ne for fere
& if me miȝte of enie wite: þat hit nere noȝt bileued
Þat he nere anon ynome: & ismyte of his heued
Þus furde þe liþere quene: & stirede hire wel faste
Þat noman ne þerste hire broþere nempne: so sore hi were of gaste
¶ Euere lai þis holi bodi: ibured swiþe stille
Þat noman ne þerste him enes nemne: aȝen þe quenes wille
So longe þat hit was al forȝute: whan me nemiȝte of him speke
Ac hit nas noȝt so þat oure louerd: atte laste him nolde awreke
Whan no man nolde þat wittie was: of him þenche ene
Nolde oure louerd þat he were: allinge forȝute so clene
Whan no man nolde þat witti was: of him habbe munde
A dombe best wiþoute witte: hadde aȝe cunde
For a widue hadde a whit cou: þat wonede þere biside
Þat ȝeode adai to fecche hire mete: in þe wode wide
Þer seint kenelm lai ibured: in þe valey þerdoune
Eche dai wolde þis white cow: whan heo com fram toune
Fecche hire mete mid oþer kyn: [MS. k] renne heo wolde alone
In to valeye al byneþe: & lete hire felawes echone
& sitte aboute þis holi bodi: forte eue al longe day
As hit were to honury him: for he alone lay
& so heo sat wiþoute mete: alday to þan ende
& whan þat hit eue was: homward he wolde wende
& an eue whan heo hom com: fat & round heo was
& so ful of mulc heo was: þat me wondrede of þe cas
For þer nas non of alle þe kyn: þat half so moche mulc ȝeue
As ful heo wolde a morwe beo: þeȝ heo were ymelked an eue
Ho so hadde suche kyn ynowe: he nere noȝt to bymene
Þeȝ his larder were neȝ ido: & his somer lese lene
¶ Þat folc þat þe wonder iseȝe: gret gome mid alle hi nome
& awaitede wel adai: whar þis cou bicome
& hi seȝe hire stitte adai: in þe valeye þerdoune
Meteles stille in one stede: forte heo ȝeode an eue to toune
& whi heo leye þer so: hi ne miȝte wite for noþing
Ac in here hurte him þoȝte wel: þat hit was sum tokning
For þis cou wonede þer so: & ech dai drouȝ þerto
Coubache me clipede þis valeye: & ȝut me doþ also
In coubache þis holi bodi: lay wel menie a ȝer
Þere me nuste noȝt of him: as ic ȝou seide er
For his soster was so fers: & in so gret prute ibroȝt
& such þretninge for him makede: þat me ne þerste him nemne noȝt
Þo þis holi bodi ne moste: beo icud in Engelonde
Oure louerd þat wot alle þing: & þerto sende his sonde
For as þe pope stod at Rome: & song his masse aday
At seint peteres weued in þe churche: as al þat folc isay
A coluere whittere þan enie snow: com adoun fram heuene fleo
& leide vpe þe weued a litel writ: & siþþe gan to heuene teo
& fleȝ vp an heȝ aȝe: as oure louerd hit wolde
Þe writ was whit & schynde briȝte: þe lettres were of golde
Þe pope þonkede ihesu crist: & al þat folk also
Þe pope nam þis holi writ: þo þe masse was ido
¶ He nuste what hit was to sigge: ne non ne couþe wite
For he ne couþe englisch non: & an englisch hit was iwrite
He let clipie ech maner diuerse men: of eche diuerse londe
If enie couþe of þis holi writ: eni þing vnderstonde
Þo were þer men of Engelonde: þat wiste what hit sede
& vnderstode wel þat writ: þo hi hit ihurde rede
Þe writ was iwrite an englisch: as me radde hit þere
& to telle hit wiþoute rym: þuse wordes riȝt hit were
In Clent in Coubache kenelm kinges bern liþ vnder a þorn heuede bireued
¶ Þis writ was nobliche: iwist & vp ido
& iholde gret relik: for ȝut hit is also
Þe nobleste relik hit is: on þerof of al Rome
As hit auȝte wel ho vnderstode: riȝt wel whannes hit come
For whan hit out of heuene com: & of oure louerdes honde
What noblerere relik miȝte þer beo: y ne mai non vnderstonde
Þerfore seint kenelmes day: as þe pope makede his heste
At Rome hi holdeþ heȝliche: & makeþ suyþe gret feste
¶ Þo þe pope to soþe wiste: what was þe tokninge
His messager into Engelonde: he sente wiþ pis tiþinge
To þe archebischop of Canterbury: wolfred þat was þo
Lettres he sende þat he scholde: such þing vndergo
& siche out of þe wode of Clent: if enie man miȝte wite
At such an haȝ þorn in Coubache: as hit was in þe write
And siche out þe holi bodi: þat durneliche lai þere
And do þat wiþ gret nobley: þat hi ischryned were
¶ Þo þis lettre fram þe pope: to þe archebischop com
Of bischops & of Clerkes: his consail þerof he nom
So þat in þe wode of Clent: þat in Wircestreschire is
Hi lete siche þis holi bodi: & fonde hit out iwis
Vnder þe þorn of Coubage: as þe writ seide at Rome
& for þe erore miracle of þe toun: þe whatlokere þerto hi come
For þe contrai men þer-biside: þat vnder-ȝete þat cas
Ouertrowede wel whar hit lay: for þe miracle so fair was
Anon so hi holi bodi vp nome: a wil spring vp þere stod
Of þe stede þer he lai on: þat ȝut is cler & god
For þer is a wille fair ynouȝ: & euere eft haþ ibeo
In þe stede as he lai on: as me maȝ þer iseo
Þat me clepeþ seint kenelmes welle: þat menie men haþ isoȝt
And menie haþ of gret siknisse: þurf þat water ibeo ibroȝt
Of þe Cite of Wynchecumbe: & of þe contrai þer biside
Þe men were mest þat soȝte so: to make þe bodi abide
For þe bischop hadde iloked: þat hit scholde þider beo ibore
& ischryned þer his fader lay: þat arerde þe hous bifore
Þis men þis holi bodi: þat of Gloucestreschire were
& nobliche toward wynchecumbe: with processioun bere
¶ Þat folc of wircestre schire: þat wonede þer biside
Nome hem to rede menie on: to make þe bodi abide
Hi suore þat hi hit wolde habbe: þat no man ne scholde hit hem reue
For in þe schire þat hit was ifonde: þat hit scholde bileue
Bi þe watere of perschore: þis two schires hem mette
& conteckede for þis holi bodi: & faste to gadere sette
So þat hi nome a forme of pees: to do godes grace
Iff god wolde his wille schowe: er hi wende out of þe place
¶ Fortrauailled hy were sore: þat hi moste slepe echon
Hi makede a forme þat hi scholde: ligge & slepe anon
& wheþer of þuse tuei schires: whatlokest miȝte awake
Al sauf scholde wende forþ: & þe bodi mid hem take
Stille hi leye & slepe faste: þis schiren boþe tuo
& reste for here wirynisse: oure louerd hit wolde so
So þat hi of Gloucestre schire: bigonne to awaki echon
Al o tyme as god hit wolde: & of wircestre schire noȝt on
In pais hi wende forþ here wey: & þe bodi wiþ hem toke
Vyf myle wei hi were awend: er þoþere awoke
¶ Þis oþere iseȝe hem bigyled: anon so hi gonne awake
Hi bigonne to suy þis oþere faste: ac hi nemiȝte hem noȝt of take
Þis men toward wynchecumbe: þis holi bodi bere
Er hi hit miȝte þider bringe: suyþe werie hi were
So þat hi come in a wode: a lute bi este þe toune
& reste þo hi were so neȝ: vp an heȝ doune
Aþurst hi were for werinisse: so sore þat hit nas ende
For seint Kenelmes loue hi bede: som drinke oure louerd hem sende
A cold welle & fair þer sprong: anoueward þis doune
Þat ȝut is þer fair & cold: a myle fram þe toune
Wel faire hit is iheled nouȝ: wiþ fair ston as riȝt is
And redi ech man to drinke þerof: þat comeþ þerforþ iwis
¶ Þe monekes siþþe of wynchecumbe: arerd habbeþ þerbiside
A fair chapel of seint kenelm: þat men sicheþ wide
¶ Quendride þe liþere quene: at wynchecumbe þo was
He nuste hire broþer noȝt so neȝ: ne noȝt of þat cas
Heo sat in seint peteres churche: biside þe abbey ȝate
In a soler in þe est side: & lokede out þerate
Þo seȝ heo al þis grete folc: anoueward þe doune anheȝ
To-ward wynchecumbe come: riȝt vnder souþ leȝ
Heo of eschte what men hit were: & what hi þoȝte þere
Me seide hire þat hi to churche wolde: & hire broþer bere
¶ Þo was þis quene sorie: in gret deol & fere
Hire sautere heo nom an honde: as heo witles were
Of þe sautere þe furste saume: tofore euesong iwis
Of cursing of liþere men: & of mansing ymaked is
Dominus laudem hit is icliped: þis saume þe quene radde
For acorsi hire broþer bodi: & þat him þider ladde
Þo heo com to þe neoȝenteoþe vers: as þe mansing endeþ iwis
Þat hoc opus eorum: a latyn icliped is
Þat saiþ what men hit scholde beo: þat scholde afonge such dede
¶ Vpe hire owe heued hit com: þo heo gan þat vers rede
For riȝt as heo þe vers radde: out berste aiþere hire eȝe
& fulle adoun vpe hire sautere: as manie men iseȝe
& þat was me þinȝþ wel ido: dai þat hire bymene
Heo ne biloȝ noȝt hire trecherie: hire biȝete was wel lene
Þe sauter is ȝut at Malmesbury: & ho-so wole come þerto
Þerinne me mai iseo: whar þe dede was ido
Þis holi bodi was forþ ibore: wiþ gret honour atte fyne
To þe abbay as he liþ ȝut: & ido in noble schryne
¶ Þis liþere quene deide siþþe: in schindisse ynouȝ
Þis bodi as a corsed wrecche: in a foul dich me drouȝ
In þe fouleste þat þere was neȝ: & þerinne me hit slouȝ
Bote hire ending schindful were: iwis hit were wouȝ
Nou god for seint kenelmes loue: his suete grace ous sende
Þat we mote to þulke ioye: þat he is inne wende: Amen.

TAILNOTE.P: [St. Margaret follows; then St. Mary Magdalen; then St. Cristine; & St. James.]

DIV2.HEAD: XIV. A MIRACLE OF ST. JAMES'S.

LG.L: In þe Cite of leouns: a ȝung man þer was also
Þat ofte to seint Jame wende: & grete loue hadde þerto
O tyme as he þuder wende: he dude ane folie
Þat menie to helle bringeþ: þe sinne of lecherie
Toward seint Jame he wende forþ: er he ischcryue were
Þe deuel was wel ȝurne aboute: him to mislere
Aȝen him hi com in þe wei: swiþe mylde & softe
Riȝt as he seint Jame were: as he bigyleþ men ofte
Wostou euere ho ic am he seide: þoþer seide nai
Ich am þulke he seide þat þu hast: isued manie o dai
Seint Jame toward wam þu ert: y ne makie of þe no mone
Þat þu nedost swiþ wel: of eche þing bote of one
Þat þu dudest þe lecherie: er þu wendest to me
Among alle men if þat nere: mest ic preisi þe
¶ Seint Jame merci quath þis oþer: ic crie me milce & ore
Forȝif me þulke liþere sinne: y nele do so no more
A bean frere quaþ þis oþer: strong is þi misdede
Þu ne miȝt me neuere paye wel: bote þu do as ic rede
Þe membre þu most kerue of: wherwiþ þu isynewed hast
Þe synne ic wole forȝyue þe þanne: whan he is fram þe icast
And neȝ me þu scholdest beo: in ioye in heuene aboue
& þu woldest beo ymartird: & þe silue matir for mie loue
A louerd, quaþ þis man, seint Jame: haue merci of me
& ic wole me martir for mi synne: & for þe loue of þe
¶ Þis wrecche man carf of his membres: & awei fram him caste
& siþþe þurf his false red: him aslouȝ atte laste
Iredi was þe schrewe þere: þe soule he nom anon
& wel glad bigan in his manere: toward helle gon
Ne forget noȝt seint Jame his pelegrim: for cas þat hi gan bitide
Aȝen þe deuel he com adoun: & bad þe schrewe abide
Þu berest he seide more þan þin owe: & þat ich wole cuþe þe
Hastou bitrayd mie pelgrim: moche schame dostou me
¶ ȝe al for noȝt quaþ þe schrewe: þu ert hider icome
In his synne him silf he slouȝ: & þerwiþ ic him habbe ynome
Ne mai no manne in dedlich synne: to þe ioye of heuene wende
As wel þu miȝt go aȝen: he is myn wiþoute ende
Þu liþere þing quaþ seint Jame: þu bitraidest him wiþ falshede
& wiþ trecherie to him come: þu let him go ic rede
Ich habbe leue quaþ þe schrewe: to bigyli & bitraye also
In eche quyntise þat mai: whi wolde he misdo
¶ Þis strif ilaste bituene hem longe: ac þo seint Jame ne miȝte
Wiþinne þe schrewe wiþ resoun: come ne wiþ riȝte
Þu schalt he seide wiþ me come: to an heȝere Justise
Þat þe schal þe trecherie ȝulde: for whan þe schal agrise
To-fore oure leuedie swete & mylde: þane schrewe he gan lede
He ȝal & quakede dulfulliche: þo he iseȝ hire for drede
ȝe ȝulle moten hi euere mo: & wo ȝou mote bitide
¶ Þe schrewe fond his macche þo: ic wot he scholde abide
Þu liþere þing quaþ oure leuedi þo: whi fondestou in alle wise
To bynyme ous & bitraye hem: þat beoþ in oure seruise
Þu ne schalt neuere þis soule broke: for þi trecherie
Leoue leuedi quaþ þe schrewe: merci ic þe crie
Vnderstond þat ich habbe leue: to bigyli men ynouȝ
& þat ich him fond in dedlich synne: & þerinne him silue a-slouȝ
& þat neuere noman in such cas: to heuene come ne miȝte
As he myn mid alle lawe: hold me ic bidde to riȝte
¶ Þu liþere best oure leuedi seide: to moche ȝoure poer is
Allas þat man nele beo war: er he do amis
As þu mid trecherie: his lyf him bynome
Al so ic wole him ȝyue aȝe: his lyf bi riȝte dome
& þanne he mai cheose as he wole: god man oþer vuel beo
Oure leuedi makede þe soule aȝe: to þe bodi fleo
Fram deþe to lyue he aros: þurf oure leuedi lore
& god lyf ladde afterward: & þe deuel doutede þe more
His membres þat he of carf: euere he dude misse
Bote a lute wharþurf he miȝte: whan he wolde pisse
& þe deuel ȝeode awey: & huld him a-gyled sore
Nadde þe schrewe neuere so moche schame: þat he nere worþe more
For he doþ men euere schame: sorewe him mote bifalle
And liþer þrift vpon his heued: amen siggeþ alle
Nou seint Jame for þe holi stede: þat þu hast in Galiȝ
Hel alle þi pelegrims & ous: & bring ous to heuene blis. Amen.
Seint Cristofre was saraȝin: in þe lond of Canaan
In no stede bi his daye: ne fond me so strong a man
Four & tuentie fet he was long: & þicke & brod ynouȝ
Such man bote he were strong: me þinȝþ hit were wouȝ
Al a contrai where he were: for him wolde fleo
Þerfore him þoȝte þat noman: aȝen him scholde beo
Wiþ no man he seide he nolde beo: bote wiþ on þat were
Hexist louerd of alle men: & vnder non oþer nere
He wende to siche such a man: so þat me him tolde
Of þe hexiste þat an vrþe was: & mest poer dude wolde
¶ Seint Cristofre him soȝte fur: atte laste he com him to
Þe kyng him eschte what he were: & what he wolde also
Þis oþer seide what he was: & þat he seruise wolde
Þe hexte man þat owhar were: & to noman abowe ne scholde
If he enie such fond: þe king aȝe sede
Þat he ne huld of no man: ne nescholde of noman beo in drede
Here aiþer was of oþer glad: Cristofre him seruede longe
¶ Þe kyng louede melodie: of harpe & of songe
So þat his iugelour adai: to-fore him pleide faste
& anemnede in his rym: þe deuel atte laste
Þo þe kyng ihurde þat: he blescede him anon
Seint Cristofre nom gode ȝeme: ane fot he nolde gon
Er he wiste whi hit were: þe kyng was loþ to telle
Þoþer seide bote þu telle me: no lenger bileue y nelle
¶ Þo þe kyng ne seȝ non oþer: leoue Cristofre he sede
Hit was for he nemnede þane: deuel: for ic haue of him drede
Eke he is quaþ Cristofre: heȝere maistre þan þu
Þat ne mai ic noȝt quaþ þe kyng: wel wiþsigge nou
Haue god dai ek quaþ þis oþer: y nele neuere wiþ þe beo
Ich wole siche þane deuel & seruie him: if ic him mai iseo
¶ Þe kyng was sorie & alle his: for he nolde abide
To siche þe deuel he wende forþ: ac naþeles noȝt wel wide
For þe schrewe is euere prest: þat to him habbeþ ynome
¶ Þo Cristofre com wiþoute þe toun: gret folc he seȝ come
Wiþ grete noblei wel anhorse: swise firse & proute
Cristofre hem mette baldeliche: of noman he nadde doute
Þe maistre þat was firs ynouȝ: com & ymette him anon
Beau sire he seide what ertou: & whoder wostou gon
Ich am he seide in mie seruise: & noman seruie y nelle
Bote mie louerd þat ic siche: þane heȝe deuel of helle
Beau frere quaþ þis oþer ic hit am: wolcome ertou to me
Þe beste seruise þat þu wolt cheose: ic wole delyurie þe
Cristofre iseȝ his grete folc: & þat he was of gret poer
Of such a louerd he was glad: & of such a mestier
¶ Þe maister het alle his men: awei bote hem tueye
To teche his mester priueiliche: as hi ȝeode bi þe weye
As hi ȝeode tellinge forþ: of þis liþere seruise
A croiȝ þer stod in þe wei: þe deuel him gan agrise.
Fur in breres & in þornes: al aboute he drouȝ
ȝe ne come he neuere in betere stede: for þulke was god ynouȝ
& þerinne were he alto-drawe: forte ic wolde him bymene
& þo he þe croice ipassed was: he tournde aȝe to þe clene
Cristofre eschte whi hit were: him was loþ to telle
Certes he seide bote þu me telle: neuere serui ic þe nelle
Cristofre quaþ þe deuel: ic wole þe seruie vayn
Wiþ þat þu seruie me þe bet: afterward wiþ al þi mayn
Wiþ a suche croice as þu iseȝe: þe heȝe god þat was here
Ouercom & in sorwe brouȝte: me & alle myne fere
Ek he is heȝire þan þu quaþ Cristofre: & haþ poer more
I ne mai hit noȝt ofsake quaþ þoþer: & þat me rueþ sore
¶ Sai þat þanne quaþ Cristofre beo leng in þi seruise
If ic of þulke heȝe manne ouȝt iwite eny wise
Forþ he wende to siche oure louerd: wide he gan gon
Atte laste he fond an hermyte: þuder he wende anon
He tolde him clanliche hou hit was: & hou he such man soȝte
I-hered beo he quaþ þe heremyte: þat in such wit þe brouȝte
For he is þi louerd leoue sone: to man he þe wrouȝte
¶ & mid his owe flesch & blod: in þe croiȝ þe bouȝte
Þu most sumwhat for him þolie: & faste eche friday
I ne faste neuere quaþ þis oþer: ne ȝut y ne may
Þu most quaþ þis oþer to churche go: & þi beden bidde also
I not quaþ Cristofre what hit is: ne y ne mai hit noȝt do
No quaþ þis hermyte þu ert strong: & her is a water biside
Þat noman mai þerouer come: bote he þe heȝire ride
Þu most in lisnisse of þi synne: þer habbe þi woninge
& whan enie man haþ to þe neod: þu most him ouer bringe
In forȝyuenisse of his misdede: he grantede þis anon
Þe ermyte him ȝaf cristendom: & let him þider gon
Cristofre biside þulke watere: & lute hous makede þere
In his hong [sic] he bar a long perche: his staf as þeȝ hit were
Whan enie man wolde ouer þat water: vpe his rug he him caste
& nom his parche & bar him ouer: & step hardeliche & faste
For he was so long & so strong: þat þer ne com so heuy non
Þat he nolde wiþ him wel baldeliche: ouer þe deope gon
¶ A niȝt in þat oþer half of þe water: a voiȝ come & gradde
Cristofre hale hale: þat he him ouer ladde
Cristofre anon vp aros: his parche an honde he nom
Wod forþ & ne fond no man: þo he to londe com
He nas bote vneþe atom: þat he ne gradde also þer
He wod forþ & ne miȝte fynde: namore þan he dude er
ȝut he gradde þe þridde tyme: þo he com hom to londe
Wiþ his rod he wod oȝe: a lute child he fond stonde
Þat child him bad par charite: þat he him ouer bere
ȝe com herforþ quaþ Cristofre: y nuste wher þu were
Wel liȝtliche þis child he nom: & in his armes him caste
Eueree as he bar þis child: hit gan to heuye faste
& þat water him wax also: Cristofre him sore agaste
To adrenche so heuy þat child was: þat vneþe he stod atte laste
He nas neuere so neȝ ouercome: at eche tyme he grunte & blaste
& leste þat child were adreynt: he ne þerste hit adoun caste
¶ Þo he was to londe icome: as him þoȝte longe er
Þat child he sette adoun to grounde: forto kele him þer
What ertou he seide so lute: & so heuy bicome
So heuy þat ic was vpe þe poynte: to adrenche ilome
Þeȝ al þe wordle hadde ileye vpe me: me þinȝþ so heuy nere
No wonder Cristofre quaþ þat child: þeȝ ic heuyere were
Þan al þe wordle for ic am more: þan al þe wordle iwis
& al þe wordle ic makede of noȝt: & al þing þat is
& þat þu þat soþe iseo: piche þi staf on þe grounde
& leuy he schal & bere frut: & blowe in a stounde
¶ Þo nuste he whar þat child bicom: Cristofre his staf nom
& piȝte in þe grounde: & also hit bicom
Þo was he sikerere þan he was: & oure louerd louede more
Forþ he wende to schewi him: & to prechi godes lore
He ihurde sigge wher cristene men: in tourment were ibroȝt
To confortie hem he wende þider: þat hi ne flecchede noȝt
Beoþ hardi he seide & stedefast: & doþ as ic ȝou lere
Þe iustise sturte vp anon: & smot him vnder þe ere
Sitte wel stille quaþ Cristofre: ic rede ne smyt no more
Ertou he seide of þulke: þu hit schalt acore sore
For if ic nere cristene man: ic wolde me awreke anon
ȝe bileoueþ on þis Maumetȝ: ymaked of treo & ston
Þat no miracle ne mowe do: namore þan so moche treo
Of mie louerdes Miracles some: bi mie staf þu schalt iseo
His rod he piȝte in þe grounde: & he gan anon
Leuie & blowe & bere frut: bifore hem echon
On such god he seide ȝe schulde bileoue: þat such virtu mai do
Hi ne þerste for he was so moche: o bold word speke him to
For his faire miracle of his staf: & for his preching also
To god tournde in þe place: soue þousend & mo
To-ward a maner wyldernisse: seint Cristofre wende
In Godes seruise to lede his lyf: as oure louerd him grace sende
¶ Þe Justise tolde þe kinge fore: þat such a man he seȝ
Tourne þatt folc & he ne þerste: for his strenȝþ come him neȝ
Þe kyng het tuo hondred knyȝtes: siche forto hi him fonde
Þat hi him nome & sone ladde: to him faste ibounde
Forþ wende þis tuo hondred knyȝtes: wel yarmed anon
Toward Cristofre his come a lute: hi bihulde him echon
Hi alle ne þerste come him neȝ: ac hanward gonne fleo
& tolde þo hi come hom: þat hi ne miȝte him noȝt iseo
¶ What ȝe cowardȝ quaþ þe kyng: nabbe ȝe him noȝt ifounde
Ich wole if he is alyue: habbe him faste ibounde
He sende oþer tuo hondred knyȝtes: þat hi him wide souȝte
& þat hi ne come neuere aȝe: bote hi him wiþ hem brouȝte
Wel yarmed hi wende forþ: & þo hi Cristofre iseȝe
Hi stode & ne þerste come no ner: ne vneþe him loke wiþ eȝe
For he was so gastliche & so moche: þat hi þerste vneþe him iseo
He miȝte wiþ a lute lupe: wel sone habbe ymaked hem fleo
¶ Þis gode man hadd god game of hem: & eschte what hi wolde
We ne þore noȝt þis knyȝtes seide: do bi þe as we wolde
For þe kyng ous het þe bringe him: þyn honde faste ibounde
If þu wolt we wolleþ him sigge: þat we nabbeþ þe noȝt ifounde
¶ Nai for gode quaþ Cristofre: ȝe ne schulle noȝt beo iblamed so
Ich wole go wiþ ȝou to loke fawe: what he wole habbe ido
He makede hem al aȝen hire wille: his honden faste bynde
& ladde him forþ harde ynouȝ: his honden faste bihynde
Bi þe wei as hi him ladde: he gan hem so lere
Þat er hi come hom to þe kyng: alle icristned hi were
Ac naþeles hi ladde him forþ: to þe king faste ibounde
Lo sire he seide godes kniȝt: nou we him habbeþ ifounde
¶ Þe kyng sat an heȝ vpe his sige: & anon þo he him iseȝ
For fere he ful to grounde anon: þat his necke to-berste neȝ
Þis kniȝtes anon to him come: & þo his wit aȝe com
Cristofre he seide tourn þi þoȝt: & bilef cristendom
Gode man þu miȝt quaþ þis oþer: as wel beo stille
Mi bodi þu hast faste ibounde: do bi me þie wille
Certes sire quaþ þis knyȝtes: þat him hadde þider ibroȝt
We habbeþ itake cristendom: we nulle bileue hit noȝt
¶ Þe king let þo in grete wraþþe: þis Cristofre in prisoun do
& þis kniȝtes bynde faste: & smyte of here heuedes also
¶ Þo þe kniȝtes biheueded were: þe kyng him biþoȝte
& tuo faire wymmen mid alle: seint Cristofre he broȝte
Nite het þat on & þoþer Aquiline: forto tourne his mod
Þo þis wymen iseȝe Cristofre: as he in prisoun stod
Hem þoȝte his face briȝtere was: þan sonne oþer mone
Merci Cristofre loude hi gradde: cristendom ȝef ous sone
¶ Cristofre teiȝte here bileue: & cristnede hem þere
Þe king hem let amorwe fecche: & loke hou hit were
& wende hi hadde þane gode man: in lecherie ibroȝt
Þis wimmen þeue him liȝt ansuere: as hi ne þeue of him noȝt
What, hou goþ þis, quaþ þe king: habbe ȝe itournd þoure þoȝt
Honoure oure godes ich ȝou rede: while ȝou is wel idoȝt
ȝoure godes beoþ worþie quaþ þis wimmen: in faire stede honoured beo
Þerfore swopeþ þe stretes: þat alle men hit mowe iseo
& we hem wolleþ onoure iwis: as riȝt is & lawe
¶ Þe king let do al as hi sede: sone & wel fawe
Þo þis maumetȝ were ibroȝt: in þe stret atte laste
Þis wymmen nome here gurdles boþe: & teide to hem wel faste
And drowe hem into al þe stret: & hewe hem to douste þere
Goþ hi seide & fecche hem leches: þat hi iheled were
¶ Þe king was þo for wraþþe wod: þat o womman he let honge
Heuye rekkes bynde to hire fet: þat hire deþ þrowes were stronge
Þo þis womman was vp idrawe: hire lymes burste wiþ-inne
Necke & synuen & oþer ek: wel auȝte heo heuene iwinne
In strong fur he let þoþer do: ac no fur ne com hire neȝ
Siþþe he let smyte of hire heued: þo he þat iseȝ
Þis holie wimmen boþe þus: to þe ioye of heuene wende
Þurf þe grace þat oure swete louerd: þur Cristofre hem sende
Þe king let fecche Cristofre: & eschte of him anon
Wheder he wolde his maumetȝ seruie oþer to deþe gon
¶ Cristofre forsoc here maumetȝ: & here seruise also
Þe king het þat me scholde anon: vpe a gridire him do
And roste him wiþ fur & pich: & þo he was þerinne idon
Awei þe gridire mylte: þat fur queynte anon
& he aros vp wiþoute harme: wroþ was þe king þo
¶ To a piler he let him bynde: & knyȝtes aboute him go
Hi schote him to stronge deþe: wiþ wel kene flo
Þer schute wiþ bowe & arblestes: tuo hondred kniȝtes & mo
Ac non arewe neȝ him ne com: ac alle abide biside
In þ'eir hi honge aboue him: as hit were forto abide
¶ Anon so þe kyng hit iseȝ: for wraþþe þider he wende
Ouer Cristofre an arewe heng: þat toward þe king kende
Boþe his eȝe smyte al out: fur vp in his heued
Þe king stod þo for angusse: as his wit were bireued
Þu vnseli wrecche quaþ Cristtofre: what is worþ þi miȝte
